intro: Bomarea rinconii, commonly known as the Rincón bomarea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features tuberous roots and produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. Its leaves are typically broad and lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Bomarea rinconii is often found in moist, shaded environments, growing in mountainous areas with cool climates.
